page.title: 16Local History
page.content: Local History Common use of ships timbers in buildings arose from from the trade in oak, cut in the area and sent to Liverpool and Glasgow for shipbuilding rather than return empty, carters brought back old ships timbers which were sold for house frames. The oldest farm is Poolspringe. The present church,St.Thomas &St.Mary was built in the last 100 years.Bryngwyn Manorwas built by Sir Joseph Rankin a century ago alongside the old manor which it joins with a bridge.The old school was built in 1849, the present one in 1967.Llanwarne has two churches, one that is roofless abandoned due to continual flooding. Wormelow has a mound of Motte and Bailey type which legend links with King Arthur.
